messages.message:
Hi Team, JPMC is facing issue while changing the class of a document in flow review. After changing the class and clicking on confirm(attached ss), it does not proceed further. We see below error in console logs. This is happening in production. Can someone please advise on this.

ticket: https://instabase.zendesk.com/agent/tickets/8525

I tried to look into this but just on't know enough about human review, I think we'll have to wait for tomorrow for Udit to be back. What I was able to find is that the error is coming from `changeRecordClassificationReducer` while trying to figure out if the previous step was a refiner step. It's either because the `currentStepId` of the record is null or one of the steps in the output schema is missing a step id. Udit will hopefully know which one of those is more likely and how it happened.

Thanks Jessica. If I’m reading @dg’s notes correctly, it looks like this is reproducible for this solution across the board. I will ask them to share a screenshot of their flow and see if this is possible to reproduce an internal version of this is any way.
That would be great!! A HAR file (from page load to when you see this error) would also be helpful
We do have a HAR but I think it’s not containing the info we need. I’ll ask for one with more detailed steps taken in hopes we can collect more info there.
The HAR file might be helpful because I can look at the flow and record that are loaded and see if either of them are missing that info I listed above that would cause that error
